name: Michael Caine
description: Acclaimed British actor known for his distinctive voice and numerous film roles spanning decades.

content.title: Biography
content.body: Michael Caine was born Maurice Joseph Micklewhite Jr. in 1933 in London, England. He began his acting career on stage and television, gaining attention with the stage name Michael Caine, inspired by the film 'The Caine Mutiny'. His breakout role came in the 1960s with 'Zulu', followed by a string of successful films.

content.title: Career
content.body: Caine has appeared in over 130 films across a wide range of genres, including 'The Ipcress File', 'Alfie', 'The Italian Job', and 'Get Carter'. Notably, he won Academy Awards for Best Supporting Actor for 'Hannah and Her Sisters' and 'The Cider House Rules'. His collaboration with director Christopher Nolan in 'The Dark Knight Trilogy' and other projects like 'Inception' and 'Interstellar' further cemented his place in cinematic history. Caine is renowned for his versatile acting skills and iconic Cockney accent.

content.title: Notable Collaborations
content.body: Michael Caine frequently collaborated with legendary directors such as Christopher Nolan and worked alongside prominent actors like Christian Bale and Morgan Freeman. His partnerships have led to critically acclaimed performances.

content.title: Legacy
content.body: Michael Caine's contributions to film have made him a revered figure in the industry, with numerous awards including two Oscars and BAFTA recognitions. His influence extends beyond acting, as he inspired many with his commitment to the craft and charismatic presence on screen.
